Package ray.rml

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Addable<T>
    An addable object is one that supports addition.
    Angle
    An angle is the figure formed by two rays sharing the same vertex end point and represents a measurement of the amount of rotation between them.
    AngleAxisRotatable<R,V extends Vector<V>>
    An angle-axis rotatable object is one that can be rotated by an angle about an arbitrary axis.
    AngleRotatable<R>
    An angle-rotatable object is one that can be rotated in only one way by an angle.
    Bufferable
    A bufferable object is one that supports making data available for a buffer for more efficient processing.
    Crossable<V extends Vector<V>>
    Crossable objects support calculating the cross-product, such as vectors.
    Divisible<T>
    A divisible object is one that supports division.
    FourDimensional
    A four-dimensional object is one that is made up of four scalar components.
    Invertible<T>
    Invertible objects can be inverted.
    LinearlyInterpolable<T>
    A linearly interpolable object is one that supports linear interpolation between itself and some other end-point.
    Matrix<M extends Matrix<M,V>,V extends Vector<V>>
    A matrix is a rectangular structure to efficiently hold scalar values.
    Matrix2
    This interface defines the operations for a square 2x2 matrix.
    Matrix3
    This interface defines the operations for a square 3x3 matrix.
    Matrix4
    This interface defines the operations for a square 4x4 matrix.
    Multiplicable<T>
    A multiplicable object is one that supports multiplication.
    Negatable<T>
    A negatable object is one that supports negation.
    Normalizable<T>
    A normalizable object is one that can be normalized.
    Quaternion
    A quaternion represents an orientation about an axis in 3D space.
    Scalable<S,V extends Vector<V>>
    A scalable object is one that can be scaled to change its size.
    ScalarProduct<T>
    Types supporting the dot-product operation must implement this interface.
    SphericallyInterpolable<T>
    A spherically interpolable object is one that supports spherical linear interpolation between itself and some other end-point.
    Subtractable<T>
    A subtractable object is one that supports subtraction.
    ThreeDimensional
    A three-dimensional object is one that is made up of three scalar components.
    Translatable<T,V extends Vector<V>>
    A translatable object is one that can be positioned and moved around in 3D space.
    Transposable<T>
    A transposable object is one that can have its values transposed, allowing columns and rows to be swapped.
    TwoDimensional
    A two-dimensional object is one that is made up of two scalar components.
    Vector<V>
    A vector is an object that represents a direction and a magnitude.
    Vector2
    This interface defines the operations for a 2-component vector.
    Vector3
    This interface defines the operations for a 3-component vector.
    Vector4
    This interface defines the operations for a 4-component vector.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Degreef
    An immutable single-precision floating point representation of an Angle, measured in degrees.
    FloatUtil
    Utility class for single-precision floating-point comparisons that take into account rounding errors.
    MathUtil
    Common mathematical operations that are shared by different types.
    Matrix2f
    An immutable single-precision floating point column-major 2x2 square matrix.
    Matrix3f
    An immutable single-precision floating point column-major 3x3 square matrix.
    Matrix4f
    An immutable single-precision floating point column-major 4x4 square matrix.
    MatrixUtil
    Utility class with helper functions for matrices.
    Quaternionf
    An immutable single-precision floating point implementation of a quaternion.
    Radianf
    An immutable single-precision floating point representation of an Angle, measured in radians.
    Vector2f
    An immutable single-precision floating point 2-component column vector.
    Vector3f
    An immutable single-precision floating point 3-component column vector.
    Vector4f
    An immutable single-precision floating point 4-component column vector.
